title: EPISTOLA Donald K. Henry
html:
EPISTOLA Donald K. Henry

Dear Friends: I just encountered an item for the Department of Startling New Attributions. Honest Doubt by Amanda Cross [otherwise Carolyn G. Heilbrun, Avalon Foundation Professor in the Humanities Emerita at Columbia University] advises us [p. 181] that “Tennyson . . . really, you know, he wrote some good lines. Virginia Woolf especially liked his phrase 'ancestral voices prophesying war.'”

Coleridge, I suspect, would be as surprised as Woolf or Tennyson to hear this notion about who really wrote “Kubla Khan.”

[Donald K. Henry]
